bill_title: appropriation for the lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University, and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for the lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred fifty- nine thousand dollars ($ 259,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the acquisition through a ten-year lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for general transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from other funds the sum of two hundred fifty-nine thousand dollars ($ 259,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the purposes of section 1 of this Act. Section 3. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2009 , shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for the lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the state aeronautics fund the sum of two hundred fifty-nine thousand dollars ($ 259,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the acquisition through a ten-year lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for general transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from other funds the sum of two hundred fifty-nine thousand dollars ($ 259,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the purposes of section 1 of this Act. Section 3. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2009 , shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for the lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University, and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one dollar ($ 1 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the acquisition through a ten-year lease, lease purchase, or financing of two airplanes for general transportation at the University of South Dakota and South Dakota State University. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from other funds the sum of two hundred fifty-nine thousand dollars ($ 259,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the purposes of section 1 of this Act. Section 3. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2009 , shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
